activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samantha K Kern

records.addlTxt:
10:09 AM 22CM36/ 22CM157 - Defendant Samantha K Kern in court.  Attorney Dominic J. Anderson in court for Samantha K Kern.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Anderson states that he has been appointed in 22CM36. 

Attorney Anderson waives the formal reading in 22CM157. Max penalties stated. Attorney Anderson enters a plea of NG.

On 22CM157: State asks for $500 signature bond 
No contact with the victim (SKM), her residence, place of employment  or any place temporary occupied by her.

No objection.

Court orders:
$500 signature bond 
No contact with the victim (SKM), her residence, place of employment  or any place temporary occupied by her.

3:48 PM 22CM36/22FO20 - Defendant Samantha K Kern in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim appear by zoom. SK doesn't have an attorney and has received the criminal complaint. Court reads the complaint and waives the formal reading. Court speaks about counsel. SK would like to enter a plea of NC and be done with this case. Court asks why NC. SK comments. Court would be willing to take a plea if given more facts. SK comments. Court speaks about forms that need to filled out before anything can be done. Attorney Harper comments and asks if the defendant waives her right to counsel for the sole limited purpose of offer exchange discussions with DA.  SK waives her right to an attorney for that purpose.
Plea hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing on April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
